• Serve: A Rapid Prototyping Framework For Designers – That looks nice, pretty much a webrick instance that runs in ANY folder you want.
  • HTTP request tracking tools – Tracking your HTTP requests is useful when you want to make sure you are getting/sending the right headers, or when you test CSRF attacks.
  • Selenium + JQuery – Although falling off the train recently, i really like selenium and this new enhancement binds it with JQuery in order to make dom traversing faster.
  • CSS vertical-align attribute – win, Chris is THE MEN.
  • Showing links when hovering over a Paragraph – Win, i like this approach of showing links only when the user is in focus, like when hovering over a table row or a relevant paragraph.
  • Debugging Rails with Rack – Awesome.
  • Non-SQL databases overview – Weird, freaky, attractive. :)
  • The paris hilton approach to web development – Funny as hell.
